stadium.name: The Sun-Baked Bowl
stadium.description: A simple, deep bowl dug from clay and sandstone on the edge of a caravan oasis. The heat is oppressive, and the 'stands' are just blankets laid on the sun-baked dunes.

stats.pregame_ritual: Eating a piece of honeycomb to 'sweeten' their victory.
Smelling a piece of burnt wood from a campfire.
Methodically tearing a large leaf into tiny, identical pieces.
Trying to teach a stray dog a complicated and useless new trick.
Humming a tune they believe only they know.
Tugging on their left earlobe three times.
Shaving one half of their mustache for important games.
Consulting a folk rhyme about the weather to predict the game's outcome.
Sticking a specific type of feather in their helmet's plume.
Organizing a small betting pool on who will score first.
Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.
Smelling a piece of burnt wood from a campfire.

Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.

stadium.name: The Old Fort
stadium.description: The team plays within the crumbling, stone-ringed ruins of an ancient hill-fort. The 'runes' are just old, weathered carvings on the standing stones that serve as obstacles.

stats.pregame_ritual: Reciting the names of legendary Trollball players of the past.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Tracing an invisible, complex sigil over their heart.
Patting every beast of burden they see on the way to the match.
Collecting a pebble from every field they've ever played on.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Spitting into their own hand and then slapping their face with it.
Reciting the names of legendary Trollball players of the past.
Braiding their hair into tight, battle-ready rows.
A toast of goat's milk to the health of their rivals.
Sharing a ceremonial, non-alcoholic grog from a communal cup.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Tracing an invisible, complex sigil over their heart.
Collecting a pebble from every field they've ever played on.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Spitting into their own hand and then slapping their face with it.
Braiding their hair into tight, battle-ready rows.
Patting every beast of burden they see on the way to the match.

preGame:
## üî• LIVE FROM THE OVEN! üî•

Welcome back, blood-thirsty listeners, to another pulse-pounding, bone-breaking Tuesday Night Trollball! I'm your host, Nok the Corrupter, broadcasting LIVE from the Sun-Baked Bowl in the Great Desert! Folks, it is HOT out here! I haven't sweated this much since Morgwae threatened to turn me into a throw rug! The air is thick with sand, the sun is beating down like a hammer, and the fans are literally cooking on the dunes! It's the perfect weather for violence!

Today, we have a clash of titans! The home team, **The Desert Spectres**, are looking to defend their sandy turf against the visiting **Kerlauger Runeguard**! Now, the Spectres are backed by my absolute best frenemy, Geth the Gravelord. You'd think with a patron like that, they'd be dead on their feet, but I saw Steve‚Äîyes, just Steve‚Äîorganizing a betting pool on the sidelines. That's the kind of entrepreneurial spirit I like! Meanwhile, Fidellia Mozelle was over there sniffing burnt wood. Whatever gets you going, kid!

On the other side, we've got the Runeguard, fresh from the ruins and backed by the White Ravens. I wonder if Colm, the realm's most cursed man, gave them a pep talk? Let's hope his bad luck didn't rub off! I watched Lashondra Niehaus in the locker room literally asking a teammate to punch her in the shoulder to get ready. That is the kind of aggressive pre-game ritual that warms my dark, shriveled heart! Grab a cactus juice, folks, because the dehydration is setting in and the violence is about to begin! PLAY BALL!
postGame:
## üõ°Ô∏è RUNEGUARD SURVIVES THE SANDBLAST! üõ°Ô∏è

Well, listeners, if you like defense, dehydration, and dropping the ball, this was the match for you! The final score in this sandy slugfest is **The Kerlauger Runeguard 2, The Desert Spectres 0**! The Runeguard take the victory, proving that you don't need water to win, just a slightly better aim than the other guys!

Let me tell you, the Spectres came out swinging weapons, not the ball! In the first half, it was a massacre! Eileen Mikihisa absolutely flattened Gurney Fadiman‚Äîsent him to the healer's tent seeing stars! Then Heyes Iver cracked Lorilee Aldred like a dry twig, and Steve‚Äîoh, wonderful Steve‚Äîtook down Lon Gabriell hard! The Runeguard were dropping like flies, folks! It looked less like a sport and more like a butcher shop run by Cyfnerth!

But you can't win on bruises alone! The ball handling was absolutely atrocious! We saw fumbles, we saw drops, we saw passes that went nowhere! Shepperd Trefler managed to take out Bahr Ethelstan right before the half, giving the Spectres a taste of their own medicine. And let's talk about Benjie Foulk for the Runeguard‚Äîpoor Benjie got destroyed! First Huesman Ring knocks her out, Eal Caundra patches her up, she gets back on the field, and BAM! Angelita Darce knocks her out *again*! That's the spirit of Trollball right there! Resilience and repeated head trauma!

Ultimately, this game was decided by one moment of competence in a sea of chaos. **Johnna Beetner** found a miracle opening and launched a shot from the 2-Point line‚ÄîAND SCORED! That leather head sailed through the uprights like a dream!

The Spectres tried to rally, but their quarterbacking was cursed‚Äîmaybe Colm *did* show up, but for the wrong team! Eileen Mikihisa, who was a beast on defense, decided to start passing the ball... to the other team! Two interceptions! One to Shepperd Trefler and one to Reginauld Cordell! You can't win if you're giving the ball away like charity!

So there you have it! The Runeguard drag themselves out of the desert with a win, leaving Geth's Spectres to lick their wounds and maybe learn how to throw a forward pass! Until next time, keep your weapons sharp and your healers on speed dial! This is Nok the Corrupter, signing off!
